Nature
We are both husband and wife and you are my wife. I have decided to give you some property, and therefore, considering it as a gift, I have built a house in the R.C.C. Midde on the property that has come to me and is in my possession and I have entered the following schedule in my possession record, and I have settled the property worth Rs. 21,58,000/- literally twenty one lakh fifty eight thousand rupees, considering it as a gift, and without taking any reward from you, and have given it to you this day, without taking any reward from you. From now on, you and your heirs, your sons and grandsons, shall have all the rights of donation, donation, exchange and sale of the said property forever. This is a written settlement document stating that from now on, neither I, my descendants nor anyone else will have any rights over the property listed in the said schedule. b

encumbranceDetails.description: VILL/COL: AKEPADU/ALL HOUSE SITES(0-0) W-B: 0-0 SURVEY: 15-3 HOUSE: 11/25-1 EXTE NT: 126SQ.Yds BUILT: 1410SQ. FT Boundires: [N]: HOUSES OF PILLI DURGA SIDDAIAH, PI LLI CHENRAYUDU [S] HOUSE OF PILLI RAM ANAIAH [E]: PANCHAYATHI CEMENT ROAD [W]: LAND OF KANCHARA SUBBA REDDY
encumbranceDetails.deedValue: 0302 Gift Settlement in f/o family Mkt.Value: Rs. 2052555 Cons.Value: Rs. 2158000

boundaries.boundaryN: Houses Of Pilli Durga Siddaiah, Pilli Chenrayudu

sections.content: The property covered under Gift Settlement deed No. 3778 of 2025, dated 04/Oct/2025, executed by Pilli Ramarao in favour of His Wife, Pilli Rajya Lakshmi, towards the property admeasuring an extent of 126 Sq. Yds., bearing house number 11/25-1, Assessment number 559, comprised in survey number 15-1, situated in Sri Rangarajapuram Village, Akepadu Grama Panchayath, Rajampeta Mandal, within the District of Annamayya, registered at sub-registrar office Rajampet (1112) is bounded as follows: North by: Houses Of Pilli Durga Siddaiah and Pilli Chendrayudu South by: House Of Pilli Ramanaiah East by: Panchayathi Cement Road West by: Land Of Kanchara Subba Reddy.
It is noted from the given documents and EC that the schedule property is not part of any active Mortgage or Lease Deed.

Note: It is to be noted that the online EC has been verified using the key parameters, namely the Document Number, Survey Number/House Number, and Split Survey/House Number of the concerned SRO, as per the Deed. However, cross-verification across multiple SROs has not been carried out due to the AP portal’s requirement of separate passwords for each search parameter, and the OTP-based authentication mechanism makes searches across multiple SROs operationally infeasible.
